recipes.name: Moroccan Spiced Brown Rice (Rice Cooker)
ingredients: 3 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into pieces
1/4 cup preserved lemon, minced, for garnish
directions: Step 1: Lightly coat the rice cooker bowl with cooking spray.
Step 2: Place the rice in the rice cooker bowl. Add the water (or vegetable stock), salt, pepper, coriander, and cardamom.
Step 3: Close the lid and select the "Brown Rice" setting on the rice cooker.
Step 4: Once the rice cooker switches to the "Keep Warm" setting, add the butter.
Step 5: Close the lid again and let the rice steam for 10 minutes.
Step 6: Fluff the rice with a fork.
Step 7: Serve hot, garnished with minced preserved lemon.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of Moroccan Spiced Brown Rice in a partially opened rice cooker, revealing the fluffy texture and glistening butter. Use soft, directional light to highlight the warm brown hues and specks of spice. A shallow depth of field focuses on the rice, blurring the background of a rustic wooden table set with a Moroccan-inspired patterned bowl and a tagine. Garnish with vibrant minced preserved lemon. The overall mood should be warm, inviting, and slightly exotic.

recipes.name: Korean Beef and Anchovy Rice Balls (Jumeokbap)
ingredients: 3 cups Cooked Short-Grain or Medium-Grain Rice (e.g., sushi rice)
80g Dried Anchovies, extra small, finely chopped
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Beef Rice Ball Filling: In a small bowl, combine 3 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp mirin, and 1.5 tbsp dark brown sugar. Mix well and set aside.
Step 2: Cook the Beef and Carrot: Preheat a pan over medium-high heat. Add the ground beef and cook until browned halfway.

Step 3: Add Carrot and Sauce: Add the diced carrots to the pan and stir. Once the beef is fully cooked, pour in the prepared sauce and add the cooked rice. Mix thoroughly and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the rice is well coated with the sauce.
Step 4: Cool the Mixture: Transfer the beef and rice mixture to a medium-sized bowl and let it cool until safe to handle.

Step 5: Shape the Rice Balls: Take a fistful of the cooled mixture and squeeze it firmly between your hands to form a compact ball. Repeat until all of the mixture is used. This should yield about 7-8 rice balls.
Step 6: Prepare the Anchovy Rice Ball Filling: In a small bowl, combine 1 1/3 tbsp soy sauce, 1 1/3 tbsp mirin, 1 tbsp dark brown sugar, ½ tbsp honey, and ½ tbsp sesame oil. Mix well and set aside.
Step 7: Cook the Anchovies: Preheat the same pan over medium-high heat. Add the chopped anchovies and stir-fry for about 1 minute to reduce any fishy smell.
Step 8: Add Sauce to Anchovies: Pour the prepared anchovy sauce over the anchovies and mix well. Cook for another minute until the anchovies are well coated.
Step 9: Combine Anchovies and Rice: In a medium-sized bowl, combine the cooked rice and the stir-fried anchovies. Mix thoroughly.

Step 10: Shape the Anchovy Rice Balls: Take a fistful of the anchovy and rice mixture and squeeze it firmly between your hands to form a compact ball. Repeat until all of the mixture is used. This should yield about 7-8 rice balls.
Step 11: Optional Coating: Roll the rice balls in seasoned seaweed flakes for added flavor.
Step 12: Serve: Serve the rice balls warm.

Use soft, diffused natural light to highlight the textures of the rice and the glistening sauce on the beef.  Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions. recipes.name: Alton Brown's Baked Brown Rice
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 375°F. Bring the water to a boil in a saucepan. Add the butter and salt, stirring until the salt dissolves and the butter melts.
Step 2: Place the rice in an 8-inch casserole dish.
Step 3: Pour the boiling water mixture over the rice and stir.
Step 4: Cover the casserole dish tightly with aluminum foil and bake on the middle rack of the preheated oven for 1 hour.
Step 5: Remove the casserole dish from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork before serving.
Step 6: Refrigerate leftovers in an airtight container. Reheat gently in the microwave or on the stovetop with a splash of water.

recipes.name: Miso Brown Rice (Rice Cooker)
directions: Step 1: Dissolve the miso in 1/4 cup of water.
Step 2: Combine the dissolved miso, remaining water or vegetable stock, brown rice, ginger, and lemon juice in the rice cooker bowl.
Step 3: Set the rice cooker to the regular or brown rice setting (if available).
Step 4: Once the rice cooker switches to "keep warm", set a timer for 15 minutes.
Step 5: After 15 minutes, fluff the rice with a rice paddle or wooden spoon.
Step 6: Discard the ginger before serving. Keep the rice on the "keep warm" setting for up to 2 hours.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Brown Rice Sushi Rolls
ingredients: 1 red bell pepper, roasted or fresh, sliced
Tamari or soy sauce (for gluten-free option)
directions: Step 1: Cook the rice: In a medium saucepan, bring the water to a boil. Add the rinsed brown rice, swirl to coat, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 18-25 minutes, or until the water is absorbed and the rice is tender. Drain any excess water if necessary.

Step 2: Prepare the sushi vinegar: While the rice is cooking, combine the rice wine vinegar, sugar, and salt in a small saucepan. Heat over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar and salt are dissolved. Transfer to a jar or dish and cool in the refrigerator.

Step 3: Season the rice: Once the rice is cooked, remove from heat and add the cooled vinegar mixture. Gently stir with a rubber spatula or fork to avoid overmixing. The rice will appear wet initially but will dry as it cools.
Step 4: Prepare the vegetables: While the rice cooks, slice the bell pepper, carrots, and cucumber into thin strips. Ensure they are not too bulky for easy rolling.

Step 5: Assemble the sushi rolls: Place a sheet of nori on a sushi mat. Dip your hands in water to prevent sticking, then spread a thin layer of rice evenly over the nori. Leave a small space at the top edge.
Step 6: Add the filling: Arrange a generous portion of the prepared vegetables in a line across the bottom three-quarters of the rice closest to you.

Step 7: Roll the sushi: Using the sushi mat, lift the bottom edge of the nori over the filling and begin rolling, tucking in the filling and gently pressing the roll as you go. Continue rolling until the sushi is completely sealed.

Step 8: Slice and serve: Using a sharp, serrated knife, slice the sushi roll into bite-sized pieces. Serve immediately with pickled ginger, tamari or soy sauce, and wasabi. Leftovers can be stored covered in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.

recipes.name: Perfect Sushi Rice
directions: Step 1: Rinse the Rice: Place the sushi rice in a large bowl. Add enough cold water to half-fill the bowl and gently swirl the rice. Drain and repeat this rinsing process 3-4 times, gently scrubbing the rice between your hands. Transfer the rinsed rice to a large saucepan and add 3 1/3 cups of water. Let it soak for at least 30 minutes, or until the water becomes clear.

Step 2: Prepare the Sushi Vinegar: In a small saucepan, combine the rice vinegar, sugar, salt, and dashi powder. Heat gently over low heat, stirring constantly until the sugar and salt dissolve completely. Do not boil. Remove from heat and let cool.

Step 3: Cook the Rice: Place the lid securely on the saucepan containing the soaked rice. Turn the heat to high and bring to a boil. Once boiling, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 15 minutes without lifting the lid. After 15 minutes, turn off the heat and let the rice stand, covered, for another 15 minutes.

Step 4: Combine Rice and Vinegar: Gently transfer the cooked rice to a large non-metallic bowl (wood or glass preferred). Pour the cooled sushi vinegar over the rice. Using a rice paddle or spatula, gently fold the vinegar into the rice using a slicing motion. While folding, use your other hand to fan the rice to cool it to room temperature.

Step 5: Serve: Serve the sushi rice immediately for best results. The rice should be shiny, sticky, and each grain distinct. If not using immediately, cover the bowl with a damp cloth to prevent the rice from drying out.

scenes.voice_over: Welcome to our sushi rice tutorial! Today, we'll learn how to make restaurant-quality sushi rice at home.  Get ready for perfectly sticky, glistening rice, ready for your favorite sushi creations.

scenes.voice_over: First, rinse the sushi rice in a bowl of cold water.  Swirl the rice gently and drain the cloudy water. Repeat this 3-4 times until the water runs clear. This removes excess starch and helps achieve that desired texture.

scenes.image_prompt: Rice soaking in a pot with clear water. A timer is visible in the corner, set for 30 minutes.
scenes.voice_over: Transfer the rinsed rice to a pot, add the water, and let it soak for at least 30 minutes.  This allows the rice to absorb water evenly for perfect cooking.

scenes.image_prompt: Small saucepan with rice vinegar, sugar, salt, and dashi powder being heated on a stove. A hand gently stirs the mixture with a whisk.
scenes.voice_over: While the rice soaks, prepare the sushi vinegar. Combine rice vinegar, sugar, salt, and dashi powder in a saucepan. Heat gently, stirring until everything dissolves.  Don't let it boil.

scenes.image_prompt: Pot of rice covered with a lid, simmering on a stovetop over low heat.  A timer shows 15 minutes.
scenes.voice_over: Place the lid on the rice pot, bring to a boil over high heat, then immediately reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes. Don't lift the lid!

scenes.image_prompt: Pot of rice with the lid slightly ajar, steam rising. A timer is displayed, indicating 15 minutes.
scenes.voice_over: After 15 minutes, turn off the heat and let the rice stand, covered, for another 15 minutes. This allows the rice to finish steaming to perfection.

scenes.image_prompt: A wooden bowl filled with cooked rice.  A hand gently folds in the sushi vinegar using a rice paddle, while the other hand fans the rice.
scenes.voice_over: Gently transfer the cooked rice to a large non-metallic bowl.  Gradually add the cooled sushi vinegar while gently folding the rice using a slicing motion.  Fan the rice to cool it quickly and enhance the shine.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of finished sushi rice in a wooden bowl, glistening and sticky.  Beside the bowl, several serving suggestions are displayed: sushi rolls, nigiri, and a bowl with various toppings.
scenes.voice_over: Your perfect sushi rice is ready! Serve immediately for the best flavor and texture. It's perfect for sushi rolls, nigiri, or rice bowls. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: Use a rice cooker for perfectly cooked sushi rice if available.
Do not lift the lid while simmering the rice to ensure proper steaming.
Fanning the rice helps to achieve a desirable sheen and texture.
A damp cloth prevents the rice from drying out if not served immediately.

Step 2: Prepare the Sushi Vinegar: While the rice is cooking, combine the rice wine vinegar, sugar, and salt in a small saucepan. Heat over medium, stirring occasionally, until the sugar and salt dissolve. Transfer to a jar or dish and cool in the refrigerator.

Step 3: Season the Rice: Once the rice is cooked, remove from heat and gently fold in the cooled vinegar mixture using a rubber spatula or fork. Avoid overmixing. The rice will appear wet initially but will dry as it cools.
Step 4: Prepare the Vegetables: While the rice cooks and cools, thinly slice the bell pepper, carrots, and cucumber. Ensure the vegetables are thinly sliced for easier rolling.
Step 5: Assemble the Sushi Rolls: Place a sheet of nori on a sushi mat. Wet your hands to prevent sticking and spread a thin, even layer of rice over the nori. Leave a small space at the top edge.
Step 6: Add Fillings: Arrange a generous portion of the sliced vegetables and alfalfa sprouts in a line across the rice about 1 inch from the bottom edge closest to you.

Step 7: Roll the Sushi: Using the sushi mat, lift the bottom edge of the nori over the filling and begin rolling tightly, tucking in the filling as you roll. Moisten the top edge of the nori with water to seal the roll. Repeat with remaining nori and fillings.

Step 8: Slice and Serve: Using a sharp, wet knife, slice each sushi roll into 6-8 equal pieces. Serve immediately with pickled ginger, tamari or soy sauce, and wasabi. Leftovers can be stored covered in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.

recipes.name: Homemade Garaetteok (Korean Rice Cakes)
ingredients: 300g wet-milled rice flour (from short or medium grain rice, such as sushi rice)
directions: Step 1: Making Rice Flour: Rinse 535g short or medium grain rice (such as sushi rice) until water runs clear. Soak in a bowl of water for 12 hours or overnight.
Step 2: Drain the rice and air dry for 1 hour.
Step 3: Grind the rice in a food processor until a fine powder forms, scraping down the sides as needed. This should take about 6 minutes.
Step 4: Sift the rice flour twice, discarding any large clumps or unground grains. Repeat grinding if necessary.
Step 5: Microwave Method: Combine rice flour, cornstarch, salt, and 1/4 of the boiling water (about 44g) in a microwave-safe bowl. Mix well. Add another 1/4 of the boiling water and mix again.
Step 6: Cover the bowl with cling wrap, leaving a small vent. Microwave for 2 minutes (based on a 1250W microwave).
Step 7: Add the remaining 1/4 of the boiling water, cover, and microwave for 1 minute 30 seconds.
Step 8: Place the dough on a silicone mat or cling wrap-covered cutting board. Wearing heat-resistant gloves, knead and pound the dough with a pestle for 5 minutes.
Step 9: Steamer Method: Combine rice flour, cornstarch, salt, and all the boiling water in a bowl. Mix well.
Step 10: Place the mixture on baking paper or a clean tea towel inside a steamer. Steam over high heat for 20 minutes.
Step 11: Place the dough on a silicone mat or cling wrap-covered cutting board. Wearing heat-resistant gloves, knead and pound the dough with a pestle for 5 minutes.
Step 12: Preparing for Tteokbokki: Divide the dough into 5 pieces, coat with sesame oil, and roll each into a 1-1.5cm diameter cylinder. Cut into 6cm lengths.
Step 13: Preparing for Tteokguk: Divide the dough into 2 pieces, coat with sesame oil, and roll each into a 2-3cm diameter cylinder. Refrigerate for 1 hour before slicing thinly and diagonally.

recipes.name: Coconut Green Curry Brown Rice
ingredients: 1 (14 ounce) can light coconut milk (Thai Kitchen preferred)
2-4 tablespoons green curry paste (Tiger Tiger preferred)
1/4 cup cashews, toasted and roughly chopped (optional)
directions: Step 1: Rinse the brown rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Step 2: Add the rinsed brown rice to the rice cooker.
Step 3: Stir in the coconut milk, 2 lime slices, and green curry paste.
Step 4: Add water to the rice cooker according to the manufacturer's instructions for brown rice, or use 1 1/2 to 2 times the volume of water as rice. Ensure the rice is fully submerged and leveled.
Step 5: Close the lid securely, plug in the rice cooker, and press the cooking switch to start.
Step 6: Once cooking is complete, allow the rice to rest for 15 minutes before opening the lid.
Step 7: Fluff the rice with a rice paddle or fork. Remove the lime slices.
Step 8: Serve the rice garnished with remaining lime slices, sliced scallions, fresh basil leaves, and toasted cashews (if desired).

recipes.name: Baked Brown Rice
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 375°F. Heat a heavy skillet (cast iron recommended) over high heat.
Step 2: Add the canola oil (or butter) to the hot skillet, then add the uncooked brown rice. Stir constantly until the rice is golden brown, with some grains appearing darker.

Step 3: While the rice is toasting, heat the water in a separate saucepan. Add the bay leaves, chicken bouillon cubes, poultry seasoning, black pepper, dried onion flakes, parsley, oregano, basil, and red pepper flakes (if using). Bring to a boil.
Step 4: Once the rice is golden brown, carefully pour it into a covered 2-quart casserole dish. Pour the boiling liquid over the rice.
Step 5: Cover the casserole dish tightly with aluminum foil and its lid to prevent steam from escaping. Bake for 1 hour.
Step 6: Remove the casserole from the oven and let it sit, covered, for 15 minutes without peeking.
Step 7: Fluff the rice with a fork before serving. Garnish with fresh cilantro or parsley, if desired.

recipes.name: Lemon Rice (Chitranna)
ingredients: 2 cups water (for stovetop cooking) or 1 to 1.25 cups water (for Instant Pot cooking)
½ teaspoon salt, or to taste
1 ½ to 2 tablespoons lemon juice, or to taste
1 teaspoon urad dal (split and skinned black lentils)
2 dried red chilies, preferably deseeded and broken into pieces
directions: Step 1: Rinse the rice grains under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak in enough water for 20-30 minutes, then drain.

Step 2: Stovetop Method: In a 2 to 3-liter pot or pressure cooker, combine the drained rice, 2 cups of water, and ½ teaspoon salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, covered, until the water is absorbed and the rice is cooked through. Alternatively, pressure cook for 2-3 whistles or 8-10 minutes on medium to medium-high heat. Allow pressure to release naturally.  Instant Pot Method: Combine the drained rice, 1 to 1.25 cups water, and salt in the Instant Pot. Pressure cook for 5 minutes on high pressure, then perform a quick release.  Spread the cooked rice on a plate or tray to cool to room temperature.

Step 3: While the rice is cooling, prepare the tempering. Heat 2 tablespoons of sesame oil in a small pan. Fry the peanuts until crunchy, then remove and set aside. In the same oil, fry the cashews until golden brown, then remove and set aside.
Step 4: Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of sesame oil in the same pan over low heat. Add the mustard seeds and allow them to splutter. Then add the urad dal and fry until golden brown.
Step 5: Add the red chilies, green chilies, and curry leaves to the pan. Sauté for a few seconds until the red chilies darken slightly.
Step 6: Turn off the heat and add the asafoetida and turmeric powder. Stir well.
Step 7: Pour the tempering over the cooled rice. Add the fried peanuts, cashews, lemon juice, and additional salt to taste. Mix thoroughly.
Step 8: Cover the rice and let it sit for 4-5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Step 9: Garnish with chopped cilantro, if desired. Serve hot with pappadums, a side vegetable salad, or coconut chutney.

recipes.name: Sesame Almond Brown Rice Balls
ingredients: Optional: Avocado cubes (tossed in lemon juice)
directions: 1. Rinse the rice in a fine-mesh strainer and drain.  If time permits, soak the rice for 1-2 hours.

2. In a thick-bottomed pot, combine the rinsed rice and water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce heat to low-medium and simmer actively, covered, for approximately 1 hour, or until the water is absorbed and the rice is cooked through. If the rice is cooked but water remains, increase heat to medium-high and cook until the water evaporates, being careful not to scorch the rice.
3. Remove the rice from heat, cover, and let rest for at least 15 minutes. Fluff with a fork.
4. Gradually incorporate the sesame seeds, chopped almonds, and green onions into the rice. Season with salt to taste.
5. Allow the rice to cool slightly before shaping.
6. Line a small cup with plastic wrap and lightly sprinkle with water. Fill the cup 2/3 full with the rice mixture.  Optional: Tuck a small piece of avocado or tofu into the center of the rice.
7. Gather the plastic wrap and twist at the base of the rice, forming a ball. Remove the plastic wrap and place the rice ball on a parchment-lined container or plate.
8. Repeat steps 6-7 with the remaining rice mixture.

recipes.name: Edamame and Pomegranate Brown Rice Bowl
directions: Step 1: Rinse the brown rice in a fine-mesh sieve under cold running water until the water runs clear. Place the rinsed rice in a medium saucepan with 400ml of water and a pinch of salt.
Step 2: Bring the water to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the saucepan, and simmer for 45 minutes, or until all the water has been absorbed and the rice is tender.
Step 3: While the rice is cooking, place the frozen edamame in a heatproof bowl and cover with boiling water. Let the edamame sit for 10 minutes, or until tender, then drain.
Step 4: Heat a dry frying pan over medium heat. Toast the nori sheets for a few seconds per side, until fragrant and slightly crisp. Remove from the pan, let cool slightly, then tear into strips.
Step 5: To prepare the dressing, combine the lemon zest and juice, orange zest and juice, honey, tamari (or soy sauce), and rice vinegar in a small jug or bowl. Whisk well to combine.
Step 6: Once the rice is cooked, drain any excess water. Fluff the rice with a fork and add half of the black sesame seeds. Pour the dressing over the rice and gently mix to combine.
Step 7: Divide the dressed rice between two serving bowls. Top with the edamame, pomegranate seeds, nori strips, chopped coriander, and the remaining black sesame seeds.

Use torn nori and black sesame seeds as garnish.  A light wood background and a linen napkin create a natural feel. Shoot from a slightly overhead angle with a shallow depth of field, focusing on the edamame.  Bright, natural lighting should highlight textures and create a fresh, inviting mood.  Include a hint of orange and lemon zest in the foreground.

recipes.name: Coconut Brown Rice Pudding with Dried Fruit and Almonds
ingredients: 4 cups cooked aromatic brown rice (such as brown jasmine or brown basmati)
1/2 cup dried cranberries or dried tart cherries
1 1/3 cups milk (dairy or plant-based, such as soy or rice milk)
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Lightly grease a 6-quart oven-safe casserole dish or slow cooker.
Step 2: In a large bowl, combine the cooked brown rice, dried fruit, granulated sugar, brown sugar, and cardamom.
Step 3: In a separate saucepan, whisk together the coconut milk, milk, and egg. Heat over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture is hot but not boiling.
Step 4: Remove the milk mixture from the heat and stir in the almond extract.
Step 5: Pour the milk mixture over the rice mixture in the casserole dish or slow cooker. Stir to combine.
Step 6: Slow Cooker Method: Cook on low for 2-2 1/2 hours, or until the liquid is absorbed. Oven Method: Bake for 1 hour, or until the liquid is absorbed.
Step 7: If desired, garnish each serving with toasted slivered almonds.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a styled image of Coconut Brown Rice Pudding in a shallow, rustic bowl.  Focus on the creamy texture, garnished with toasted slivered almonds and a few vibrant cranberries.  Use a soft, diffused natural light source from the side to highlight the pudding's richness and the glistening almonds.  A neutral, textured background with a linen napkin subtly draped will enhance the cozy, inviting mood.  Shallow depth of field, focusing on the center of the dish, with the background slightly blurred.

scenes.voice_over: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 175 degrees Celsius. Lightly grease a 6-quart oven-safe casserole dish. You can also use a slow cooker for this recipe.

scenes.voice_over: In a large bowl, combine the cooked brown rice, dried fruit, granulated sugar, brown sugar, and cardamom. Mix well to ensure the spices and sugars are evenly distributed.

scenes.image_prompt: Saucepan on the stovetop with coconut milk, milk, and egg being whisked together. Inset: medium heat.
scenes.voice_over: In a separate saucepan, whisk together the coconut milk, milk, and egg. Heat over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture is hot but not boiling. Be careful not to scorch the milk.

scenes.image_prompt: Almond extract being stirred into the warm milk mixture.
scenes.voice_over: Remove the milk mixture from the heat and stir in the almond extract. This adds a wonderful aroma and flavor to the pudding.

scenes.image_prompt: Pouring the milk mixture over the rice mixture in the casserole dish and stirring to combine.
scenes.voice_over: Pour the warm milk mixture over the rice mixture in the casserole dish. Stir gently to combine all the ingredients.

scenes.image_prompt: Casserole dish in the oven. Inset: baking for 1 hour at 350°F. Alternate: Slow cooker with the lid on, cooking on low for 2-2 1/2 hours.
scenes.voice_over: If baking, bake for 1 hour, or until the liquid is absorbed.  If using a slow cooker, cook on low for 2 to 2 1/2 hours, or until the liquid is absorbed.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the finished coconut brown rice pudding, garnished with toasted slivered almonds. A spoon is scooping out a serving.
scenes.voice_over: Once the pudding is cooked, let it cool slightly before serving. Garnish each serving with toasted slivered almonds for added crunch. This recipe makes a delicious and comforting dessert or breakfast. Each serving has approximately 250 calories, 5 grams of protein, 45 grams of carbs, and 8 grams of fat. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, use full-fat coconut milk.
If using a slow cooker, ensure it's lightly greased to prevent sticking.
Adjust the amount of sugar to your preference.
Soaking the dried fruit in warm water for 10 minutes before adding to the pudding can plump them up and enhance their flavor.

recipes.name: Mimi's Savory Dirty Brown Rice
ingredients: 1/2 cup chopped red bell pepper or 1/2 cup chopped green bell pepper
1 cup brown rice or 1 cup basmati rice
2 1/4 cups chicken broth or 2 1/4 cups beef broth
directions: Step 1: Combine ground black pepper, paprika, dry mustard, cumin, thyme, oregano, and red pepper in a small bowl and set aside.
Step 2: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add ground beef and bay leaves to the skillet.
Step 3: Brown the ground beef thoroughly, breaking it up with a spoon. Drain off any excess grease.
Step 4: Stir in the combined seasonings from Step 1.
Step 5: Add the chopped onion, celery, and bell pepper to the skillet. Stir well and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Step 6: Add minced garlic and butter to the skillet. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook for 10 minutes, stirring frequently.
Step 7: Pour in the chicken or beef broth and add the rice. Stir well to combine.
Step 8: Cover the skillet and reduce heat to low. Simmer for approximately 45 minutes, or according to the package directions for the rice.
Step 9: Remove the skillet from heat and let it stand, covered, for 5-10 minutes before serving.
Step 10: Note: You may need to adjust the amount of broth used based on the rice's absorption. 2 1/4 cups usually works well, but add a little more for a "wetter" rice.

recipes.name: Sushi Rice for Maki (Rice Cooker Method)
ingredients: 2 ½ cups sushi rice (short-grain, such as Koshihikari)
directions: Step 1: Rinse the sushi rice thoroughly under cold running water until the water runs clear. Place the rinsed rice in the rice cooker bowl.

Step 2: Add the appropriate amount of water according to your rice cooker's instructions for the quantity of rice used. For example, if 2 ½ cups of rice requires 4 measures of water in your rice cooker, fill the bowl to the '4' marker.
Step 3: While the rice cooks, prepare the sushi vinegar dressing. In a small bowl, combine the rice vinegar, mirin, caster sugar, and salt.
Step 4: Stir the dressing ingredients well until the sugar and salt are completely dissolved.

Step 5: Start cooking the rice according to your rice cooker's instructions. Once the rice cooker switches to 'Keep Warm' or indicates the rice is cooked, allow it to rest for 5-10 minutes with the lid closed.
Step 6: Carefully remove the rice cooker bowl and place it on a heat-resistant trivet or mat on your countertop.
Step 7: Prepare a handheld fan or set up an electric fan nearby, positioning it a short distance away from the rice to aid in the cooling and glossing process.

Step 8: Gradually pour a small amount of the sushi vinegar dressing over the rice in a spiral pattern, starting from the outside and working your way inwards. Use a rice paddle or spatula (preferably a non-metallic one) to gently fold and mix the rice while simultaneously fanning it.
Step 9: Continue adding the dressing little by little, gently folding and fanning until all of the dressing is incorporated, and the rice has cooled to lukewarm and achieved a glossy sheen.

A wooden rice paddle rests gently on the side. Soft, diffused natural light from the upper left highlights the individual grains and glossy sheen. Shallow depth of field focuses on the center of the rice, blurring towards the edges.  Garnish with a few scattered sesame seeds. Aim for a bright, clean aesthetic with a touch of rustic charm.

video_script.title: Perfect Sushi Rice for Maki (Rice Cooker Method)
video_script.description: Learn how to make perfect sushi rice for maki rolls using a rice cooker. This tutorial covers rinsing, cooking, and seasoning the rice for delicious, restaurant-quality results.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a clean surface: sushi rice in a bowl, rice vinegar, mirin, sugar, salt, and a measuring cup with water.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: Sushi rice (short-grain), rice vinegar, mirin, sugar, salt, and water.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of hands rinsing rice in a fine-mesh sieve under cold running water. The water gradually becomes clearer.
scenes.voice_over: First, rinse the sushi rice thoroughly under cold water until it runs clear. This removes excess starch.

scenes.image_prompt: Rice and water being added to the rice cooker pot.
scenes.voice_over: Place the rinsed rice in your rice cooker and add water according to your cooker's instructions.

scenes.image_prompt: Small saucepan on a stovetop, with rice vinegar, mirin, sugar, and salt being whisked together.
scenes.voice_over: While the rice cooks, let's prepare the sushi vinegar. Combine rice vinegar, mirin, sugar, and salt in a saucepan. Gently heat until the sugar and salt dissolve completely. No need to boil.

scenes.image_prompt: Rice cooker steaming, switching to 'Keep Warm'.
scenes.voice_over: Once the rice is cooked, let it rest for 10 minutes in the cooker with the lid closed.

scenes.image_prompt: Rice being transferred from the cooker to a large wooden bowl (hangiri) or a non-metallic wide, shallow container.
scenes.voice_over: Gently transfer the cooked rice to a large non-metallic bowl or hangiri. Prepare a fan for cooling and glossing. Gradually pour the sushi vinegar over the rice in a spiral, gently folding with a rice paddle while fanning.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of hands gently folding and fanning the rice with a wooden rice paddle (shamoji), sushi vinegar dressing glistening on the rice.
scenes.voice_over: Continue folding and fanning until the rice has cooled to lukewarm and has a glossy sheen. Be gentle to avoid breaking the grains.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of the finished sushi rice: glossy, slightly sticky, and ready to be used for maki.
scenes.voice_over: And there you have it! Perfect sushi rice, ready to be used in your favorite maki rolls.

cooking_tips: Use a good quality short-grain sushi rice for best results.
Do not lift the lid of the rice cooker during the cooking or resting period.
Use a non-metallic rice paddle or spatula, such as a wooden or plastic one (called a 'shamoji'), to prevent the rice from becoming sticky and to avoid reacting with the vinegar.
Fanning the rice while mixing in the dressing helps to cool it quickly, develop a glossy sheen, and prevent it from becoming mushy.

recipes.name: Cheesy Spinach and Black Bean Brown Rice Casserole
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
1 1/2 cups shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese, divided
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F. Lightly grease a 1 1/2-quart casserole dish with nonstick cooking spray.
Step 2: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic and cook until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
Step 3: Add the spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted.
Step 4: Remove the skillet from the heat and transfer the mixture to a large bowl. Add the cooked brown rice, rinsed and drained black beans, chili powder, and chopped green chiles. Stir to combine.
Step 5: In a separate bowl, whisk together the ricotta cheese and milk until smooth. Stir in 1 cup of the mozzarella cheese.
Step 6: Spread half of the rice mixture in the prepared casserole dish. Top with half of the ricotta mixture. Repeat the layers, ending with the rice mixture.
Step 7: Cover the casserole dish and bake for 30 minutes.
Step 8: Uncover the casserole, sprinkle the remaining 1/2 cup of mozzarella cheese over the top, and bake for another 5-10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

recipes.name: Harvest Turkey, Cranberry, and Brown Rice Salad
ingredients: 1 teaspoon salt, or more to taste
1 pound turkey, roasted, smoked, skinless, cut into 1/2-inch dice
1 cup dried cranberries, soaked in hot water for 10 minutes, drained, and dried
Black pepper, freshly ground, to taste
Lettuce greens (spinach, red leaf, or Boston), to taste
1 tablespoon fresh tarragon, chopped, or 1-1 1/2 tablespoons fresh parsley, flat-leaf
directions: 1. **Prepare the dressing:** In a small, heavy saucepan, combine orange juice, vinegar, and 1 tablespoon fresh or 1 teaspoon dried tarragon. Cook over medium-high heat until the mixture is reduced to about 6 tablespoons.
2. Pour the reduced mixture into a bowl. Whisk in garlic, salt, pepper, and canola oil until well blended. Set aside.
3. **Prepare the salad:** Melt butter in a heavy, medium-sized saucepan over medium heat. Add the rice and stir until all grains are coated.

4. Pour in the chicken stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer, cover, and cook until the rice is tender, about 30-40 minutes for brown rice or 20-25 minutes for Texmati rice. If using Texmati rice, remove from heat and keep covered for 10 minutes after cooking.
5. Remove the rice from heat and let it cool. Once cooled, toss the rice with the prepared dressing.
6. Add the diced turkey, cranberries, pecans, green onions, grapes, orange zest, and 1-1 1/2 tablespoons chopped fresh or 1/2-2 teaspoons dried tarragon to the rice mixture.  Toss gently to combine.
7. Taste and season the salad with additional salt, pepper, and tarragon, if desired.
8. **To serve:** Arrange a border of lettuce leaves on a serving plate, if desired. Mound the salad on top. Garnish with additional chopped tarragon and orange slices, if desired.

recipes.name: Brown Rice with Apple and Onion
directions: Step 1: Cook the brown rice according to package directions. This typically involves bringing the water to a boil, adding the rice, returning to a boil, then reducing heat to a simmer, covering, and cooking for approximately 45 minutes.
Step 2: While the rice is cooking, melt the margarine (or butter) in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Step 3: Add the chopped onion to the skillet and sauté until softened and translucent, about 3-5 minutes.
Step 4: Add the chopped apple to the skillet and cook alongside the onion for another 5 minutes, until slightly softened.
Step 5: Once the rice is cooked, add it to the skillet with the apple and onion mixture.
Step 6: Gently toss the rice, apple, and onion together until heated through.
Step 7: Serve warm.

recipes.name: Turkey and Brown Rice Chili
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can chili beans in sauce, undrained
1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chiles, drained
directions: Step 1: Heat the vegetable oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium heat. Add the ground turkey and chopped onion to the skillet. Cook for 8-10 minutes, stirring frequently, until the turkey is no longer pink. Drain off any excess grease.

Step 2: Transfer the cooked turkey and onion mixture to a 3-4 quart slow cooker. Add the undrained diced tomatoes, undrained chili beans, drained green chiles, water, sugar, chili powder, cumin, and salt. Stir to combine.
Step 3: Cover the slow cooker and cook on low for 8-10 hours.
Step 4: Stir in the cooked brown rice. Increase the heat setting to high, cover, and cook for about 15 minutes, or until the rice is heated through.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a steaming bowl of turkey and brown rice chili, garnished with fresh cilantro and a dollop of sour cream. Use a dark, rustic wooden background and textured linen napkins. Shoot from a slightly overhead angle, focusing on the chili's rich texture and vibrant colors. Incorporate shallow depth of field, highlighting the foreground chili while subtly blurring the background elements. Employ warm, inviting lighting to create a cozy, comforting mood. A scattering of dried chili flakes around the bowl adds a touch of spice and visual interest.

recipes.name: Thai Coconut Brown Rice
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups brown jasmine rice (or basmati rice)
directions: Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
Step 2: Lightly coat the bottom of a medium-sized pot (with a tight-fitting lid) with coconut oil.
Step 3: Add the rice, coconut milk, water, salt, and shredded coconut to the pot. Stir to combine.
Step 4: Place the pot over high heat and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer (avoid a rolling boil).
Step 5: Immediately reduce the heat to low (just above the lowest setting), cover the pot tightly with the lid, and cook for 1 hour, or until the liquid has been absorbed by the rice.
Step 6: Once the liquid is absorbed, turn off the heat but leave the pot on the burner, still covered. Let the rice rest for 5-10 minutes to steam.
Step 7: Fluff the rice with a fork or chopsticks before serving.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of Thai Coconut Brown Rice in a shallow, textured ceramic bowl.  Use soft, diffused natural light to highlight the creamy texture of the coconut milk and the individual grains of rice. Garnish with toasted coconut flakes and a few pandan leaves.  Focus sharply on the rice in the foreground, with a shallow depth of field blurring the background. The overall mood should be warm, inviting, and slightly rustic, with a muted color palette of beige, cream, and green.  Include a wooden spoon partially submerged in the rice and a linen napkin draped over the side of the bowl.

recipes.name: Classic Brown Rice Pilaf
ingredients: 2 1/2 cups low-sodium chicken broth (or vegetable broth)
directions: Step 1: Heat the olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat.
Step 2: Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the saucepan. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is softened and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Step 3: Add the brown rice to the saucepan and sauté for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Step 4: Pour in the chicken (or vegetable) broth and season with salt and pepper to taste. Bring the mixture to a boil.
Step 5: Reduce the heat to low, cover the saucepan tightly, and simmer for 45-50 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed.
Step 6: Check the rice occasionally during cooking and add a little water if needed to prevent sticking.
Step 7: Once the rice is cooked, remove the saucepan from the heat and let it stand, covered, for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork and serving.

video_script.title: Classic Brown Rice Pilaf

scenes.voice_over: Heat one tablespoon of olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat.

scenes.image_prompt: Chopped onion and minced garlic being sautéed in the saucepan, stirring occasionally.
scenes.voice_over: Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the saucepan. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the onion is softened and translucent.

recipes.name: Roast Pumpkin, Brown Rice, and Seed Salad with Lime Dressing
ingredients: 1 kg Kent pumpkin, peeled, deseeded, and cut into 2-3cm pieces
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 200°C.
2. Lightly grease a large baking tray with olive oil spray.
3. Arrange the pumpkin pieces in a single layer on the prepared tray and lightly spray with olive oil.
4. Bake for 30 minutes, turning halfway through, until light brown and tender.
5. Remove from oven and set aside to cool to room temperature.
6. Meanwhile, cook the rice in a large saucepan of boiling water for 30 minutes, or until tender but not overcooked.
7. Drain the rice in a large colander and set aside to cool to room temperature.
8. Reduce oven temperature to 180°C.
9. Spread the pepitas and sunflower seed kernels over a large baking tray.
10. Bake for 5 minutes, stirring halfway through, until lightly toasted.
11. Remove from oven and set aside to cool slightly.
12. In a small jug, combine the lime juice, soy sauce, sesame oil, crushed garlic, and brown sugar.
13. Place the cooled rice in a large bowl.
14. Drizzle the lime juice mixture over the rice and gently stir until well combined.
15. Add the rocket, roasted pumpkin, toasted pepitas, and sunflower seed kernels to the rice mixture.
16. Gently stir until well combined.
17. Spoon the salad onto serving plates and serve immediately.

scenes.text: Roast Pumpkin, Brown Rice, and Seed Salad
scenes.voice_over: Looking for a healthy and delicious meal? This Roast Pumpkin, Brown Rice, and Seed Salad is packed with flavor and nutrients. It's perfect for a light lunch or a satisfying dinner.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the ingredients for roasting the pumpkin, including a whole Kent pumpkin, olive oil spray, a knife, and a cutting board.
scenes.voice_over: Let's start by roasting our pumpkin. You'll need one kilogram of Kent pumpkin, peeled, deseeded, and cut into 2-3cm pieces. A little olive oil spray and a baking tray will also come in handy.

scenes.image_prompt: Show a baking tray with pumpkin arranged on it. Zoom out to show someone preheating the oven to 200°C. Overlay the oven temperature 200C.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your oven to 200 degrees Celsius. Arrange the pumpkin pieces on a baking tray, lightly spray with olive oil, and bake for 30 minutes, turning halfway through. The pumpkin is perfectly roasted when tender and slightly browned.

scenes.image_prompt: Display brown rice, pepitas, and sunflower seeds next to each other.
scenes.voice_over: While the pumpkin is roasting, cook 400 grams of long-grain brown rice according to package directions for approximately 30 minutes. For added crunch, we'll also toast 1/3 cup each of pepitas and sunflower seeds. Once roasted at 180 degrees Celcius, remove from oven and cool slightly.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the ingredients for the lime dressing grouped together: lime juice, soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic clove, and brown sugar.
scenes.voice_over: For the zesty lime dressing, whisk together 1/3 cup of fresh lime juice, a tablespoon of soy sauce, half a teaspoon of sesame oil, one crushed garlic clove, and a quarter teaspoon of brown sugar.

scenes.image_prompt: In a large bowl, combine the cooked rice and the lime dressing. Show the mixing process.
scenes.voice_over: Once the rice is cooked and cooled, combine it with the prepared lime dressing in a large bowl. Gently mix until the rice is evenly coated.

scenes.image_prompt: Add rocket leaves, roasted pumpkin, and toasted seeds to the rice mixture. Gently toss until well combined.
scenes.voice_over: Now add a bunch of washed rocket leaves, our perfectly roasted pumpkin pieces, and the toasted pepitas and sunflower seeds to the rice mixture. Gently stir everything together until well combined.

scenes.image_prompt: Show two plates of the finished salad, garnished with extra toasted seeds.
scenes.voice_over: Spoon the salad onto serving plates and serve immediately. You can garnish with a few extra toasted seeds for extra flavor and presentation. Each serving is approximately 350 calories with 12 grams of protein, 60 grams of carbs and 15 grams of fat.  Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For extra flavor, toast the pepitas and sunflower seeds in a dry pan on the stovetop instead of the oven.
If you don't have rocket, you can substitute with spinach or other leafy greens.
Add a pinch of chili flakes to the dressing for a spicy kick.

recipes.name: Sesame Brown Rice
ingredients: 360 g (3 cups) Sunrice quick cooking brown rice
Tofu & Pumpkin Green Curry (see related recipe), for serving
directions: Step 1: Heat a medium saucepan over medium heat.
Step 2: Add the sesame seeds and cook, tossing frequently, for 1 minute or until lightly toasted.
Step 3: Add the water to the saucepan.
Step 4: Increase heat to high and bring the water to a boil.
Step 5: Add the rice and return to a boil.
Step 6: Reduce heat to medium-low, cover the saucepan slightly, and simmer for 10 minutes or until the rice is tender and all the liquid is absorbed.
Step 7: Remove the saucepan from the heat.
Step 8: Use a fork to fluff and separate the rice grains.
Step 9: Season the rice with salt and pepper to taste.
Step 10: Divide the rice among serving bowls.
Step 11: Top with Tofu & Pumpkin Green Curry (see related recipe) and serve.

Use soft, directional lighting to highlight the glistening sesame seeds and individual grains of rice. A shallow depth of field should focus sharply on the foreground rice, blurring the background elements of a dark wood table and a partially visible serving of Tofu & Pumpkin Green Curry. The mood should be warm, inviting, and appetizing.

video_script.title: Sesame Brown Rice

scenes.voice_over: Give it a stir, then reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the saucepan slightly, and let it simmer for 10 minutes, or until the rice is tender and all the liquid is absorbed.

scenes.voice_over: Once the rice is cooked, remove the saucepan from the heat and use a fork to fluff and separate the grains.
